function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Strategies not specifically developed to minimize transmission of infectious diseases","Impact":"Increased risk of transmission of infectious diseases in the built environment","Mitigation":"Incorporate specific measures to minimize the transmission of infectious diseases in building sustainability strategies","Technologies":"Advanced air filtration, UV-C disinfection, touchless technology, and monitoring systems","People":"Occupants, visitors, and workers in the built environment","Owner":"Building developers, facility managers, and policymakers"},{"Description":"Inadequate level of sustainability of the strategies in response to the COVID-19 pandemic","Impact":"Reduced effectiveness of strategies in mitigating the transmission of COVID-19 and other infectious diseases","Mitigation":"Update and adapt sustainability rating systems to address the specific challenges posed by infectious diseases, including COVID-19","Technologies":"Data analytics, modeling tools, and adaptive design approaches","People":"Sustainability assessors, researchers, and policymakers","Owner":"Sustainability rating system organizations and regulatory bodies"},{"Description":"Limitations of Sustainability Rating Systems (SRS) in assessing building sustainability","Impact":"Inaccurate evaluation of building sustainability, potentially leading to inadequate risk mitigation for infectious diseases","Mitigation":"Enhance the criteria and assessment protocols of SRS to address the specific risks posed by infectious diseases in the built environment","Technologies":"Building performance simulation, indoor air quality monitoring, and epidemiological modeling","People":"Sustainability assessors, building designers, and public health experts","Owner":"Sustainability rating system organizations, public health agencies, and building industry stakeholders"}]}
